answerText: Poisson bracket[10] The central equations of Hamiltonian mechanics can be written elegantly using the Poisson bracket, where the Hamiltonian represents this quantity for a system. The kinetic type of this quantity is given by one-half m v squared.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | 1. Chicago A - MIT B | 1 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A connection between classical mechanics and quantum mechanics can be seen by using Dirac's rule of replacing this operation with the commutator. For 10 points each: [10] Name this operation which, for f and g in one dimension, is given by the partial of f with respect to q times the partial of g with respect to p minus the partial of f with respect to p times the partial of g with respect to q.
